headline: Pelosi challenges Trump on wall, House GOP hits back
subHeadline: Guests: Tom Homan, Raheem Kassam, David Goodfriend, Jeffrey Lord, Steve Scalise, Ann Coulter, Ladawn Jones, Horace Cooper, Antjuan Seawright

utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, HOST
utterances.sentences: All right, I am Laura Ingraham. This is "The Ingraham Angle" from Washington tonight. An Oval Office throw down where Democrats pleas for privacy reveal their losing hand on immigration. Plus, the disgusting origin story of the radical Women's March. We're going to have a new expose that may imperil some of the Democrats newest stars and this story is completely wacko. Vice News is promoting an overseas vacation retreat that bans white people. Yes it's true. The debate over what can only be described as a new form of voluntary segregation. But first, guardians of the fallacy, that's the focus of tonight's "Angle."  The political and media establishment, they've been at war and a cold war really with Donald Trump for more than three years now. And from the outset, he represented everything they hate, and not just his America First policies, but his brash, take no prisoners style that threatened to crash their exclusive club.  But as the Mueller probe and its new New York offshoot come to a head, the media feel well-positioned to recast their image from #fakenews to galaxy saving superheroes like Batman or Aquaman. They've decided to try a franchise reboot. The first comes courtesy of "Time" magazine's person of the year.  EDWARD FELSENTHAL, EDITOR-IN-CHIEF & CEO, TIME: As we looked at the choices, it became clear that the manipulation and abuse of truth is really the common thread in so many of this year's major stories, from Russia to Riyadh to Silicon Valley. And so we chose to highlight four individuals and one group who have taken great risks in pursuit of greater truths.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And I only heard -- caught the last part of what he said when I first saw this and I thought, oh wow, they are giving it to China's persecuted Christians. That's amazing. Well, instead, "Time" magazine has kept the award kind of inside the family and named a group of journalists as the people of the year with the understated title "The Guardians and the War on Truth."  The group includes slain journalist Jamal Khashoggi and the Capital Gazette staff which lost members of course when a shooter opened fire on their offices. Of course, we love objective journalists and the targeting of reporters just because they are doing their jobs is despicable. Well also, isn't there something kind of transparently self-serving about journalists giving awards to other journalists?   Well, to his credit and professionalism, Capital Gazette editor Rick Hutzell expressed uneasiness about the recognition. He said I hate being the story. And he added that this was the first sit-down interview he had done since that June attack. Good for him. By the way, as an aside, later in the show, we will reveal whom we would have picked for persons of the year. So stay with us for that. It's going to be a lot of fun. But by the way, Time isn't the only aging outfit trying to resurrect its damaged reputation. Retired senators are also lumbering back from obscurity to claim the mantle of moral and intellectual superiority. Rising from the political dead, they promised that their wisdom will save us from Trump. You've got to read between the lines. All you need to know though was that op-ed was the brainchild of Trump basher extraordinaire Chuck Hagel and Connecticut liberal Chris Dodd. They said on part, "We are on the eve of the conclusion of the special counsel Robert S. Mueller's investigation and the House commencement of investigations of the president and his administration -- we urge current and future senators to be steadfast and zealous guardians of our democracy by ensuring that partisanship for self-interests not replace national interests."   Well, kind of high-minded malarkey signifying nothing. Well, look, I will forever salute Chuck Hagel's military service but that doesn't give him immunity from political criticism that is just kind of brain dead. Where was the bipartisan cabal when we needed to guardians of the rule of law and transparency during the Obama years? Fast & Furious, Benghazi, the IRS scandal, the Clinton e-mail cover-up, the horrors at the VA, the green energy boondoggles involving companies like Solyndra just to name a few. Where were these 44 senators when we needed guardians of our border? Where were they when we needed guardians against the rigged trade deals that empowered a ruthless communist regime in China? And where were they when we need guardians against activist judges who stray far, far beyond their Article 3 powers? Look, Donald Trump ain't perfect. None of us are. None of us is, to be grammatically correct. But he's done more in two years to try to safeguard America, the country we love, than all those senators who signed that op-ed combined. The media and failed politicos are guardians. They are guardians of a fallacy that the American people need protection from their own political choices.  The president was duly elected and is entering the third year of his first term, but the media and political establishment are still in denial. Do you notice by the way that they basically given up on substantive debate on any of the issues that Trump is really tackling? Instead they often prefer personal invective to pragmatic solutions.

utterances.speaker: RUTH MARCUS, DEPUTY EDITORIAL PAGE EDITOR, WASHINGTON POST
utterances.sentences: The president has very little in the way of attention span. The president is undisciplined.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Secretary Tillerson, you know, called him an effing moron with not for nothing is the highest rank of moron (inaudible) that's achievable.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: He gets bored after about 15 seconds. Even people talking to him.

utterances.speaker: REP. KAREN BASS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: He doesn't want information. He comes into the job with very little knowledge.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, if he is that uninformed, how did he beat all you smart people? That's my question. My fiends, populist movements are popping up all over the world. They are challenging the old political orders that have failed to raise the standard of living of their own people or to safeguard the culture.  Folks aren't mad because they enjoy being mad. They are mad because politicians have screwed things up so badly across the board. But the guardians of the old order, they right now feel empowered by Trump's legal woes and a new Democrat majority in the House.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: -- call a halt to this. We have come in here as a first branch of government. Article I, the legislative branch. We are coming in, in good faith to negotiate with you about how we can keep the government open. The American --

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We are going to keep it open if we have border security. If we don't have border security, we are not going to keep it open.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I'm with you. I'm with you. We are going to have border security.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: And it's the same border -- you are bragging about what has been done.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: By us.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: We want to do the same thing we did last year, this year. That's our proposal. If it's good then, it's good now and it won't shut down the government.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Chuck, we can build a much bigger section with more money.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: Let's debate in private, OK? Yes. Let's debate in private.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Let's keep all this private. And then the media guardians, they jumped in with their questions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you define what it means to have border security? Â TRUMP: We need border security. The wall is a part of border security.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: We came here in good faith and we are entering into this kind of discussion in public view.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: But it's not bad, Nancy. It's called transparency.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: We shut down the government over a dispute and you want to shut it down. You keep talking about it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. The last time Chuck you shut it down --

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: No, no, no --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And then you opened it up very quickly.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: Twenty times.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: If we don't get what we want, one way or the other, whether it's through you, through a military, through anything you want to call, I will shut down the government. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: OK. Fair enough. We disagree.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: And I am proud -- and I'll tell you what --

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.sentences: We disagree.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am proud to shut down the government for border security, Chuck.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, it's pretty amazing watching this whole thing play out because by refusing to be cowed by warnings that a partial government shutdown would damage him and his party politically, well the president is actually doing what the retired senators claim to want.   He is standing on principle by acting on the urgent need to preserve the sovereignty and security of our country. And by the way, notice what Pelosi said several times during that very fiery exchange.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: The point is, is that there are equities to be weighed and we are here to have a conversation --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: -- in a careful way, so I don't think we should have a debate in front of the press on this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We would do it immediately. We will get it passed very easily in the House.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: No, that's not the point.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We will get it --

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Again, let us have our conversation and then we can meet with the press again.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Wait a second, wait a second. I thought the liberals were all about transparency and protecting the guardians of the truth. But the moment the guardians report on their conversations, Nancy wants them shooed out of the room. This exchange shows in dramatic fashion why Trump has so confounded the establishment. He pulls the veil back, allowing the American people to see just how unreasonable and how petty the Democrats have become. Because an agreement on wall funding may give Trump I guess a partial victory. They refused to budge, even if the DACA kids end up getting a path to citizenship in the process, which they would've gotten last February. And no matter how much a deal would help the country, guess what? The Democrats don't care. Score settling and preventing Trump from declaring victory on something. And that's the "Angle."  Joining me now with a reaction is Raheem Kassam, Lincoln fellow at the Claremont Institute and author of the new piece, "Time's Failing Person of the Year List a Product of Cultural Decline." David Goodfriend, former aide to President Clinton is also here along with Jeffrey Lord, contributing editor to "The American Spectator" and former aide to President Reagan.  Raheem, let's start with you. Your thoughts on the failure of the media and Democrats who can't seem to grasp the current moment. What happened today for instance?

utterances.speaker: RAHEEM KASSAM, LINCOLN FELLOW, CLAREMONT INSTITUTE
utterances.sentences: They love slapping themselves on the back. And the Time magazine cover is just more of them slapping themselves on the back and saying, you know, we are the people that you should all aspire to and that you should all listen to. I mean, you remember when, I think it was the Hillary Clinton e-mails came out and they said, you know, you are not supposed to read this. The public aren't supposed to read it but we will filter this for you and you just listen to what we say. And the same thing you saw happening today as well.  I mean, imagine that room, imagine the Oval Office if the roles have been reversed and those were Republican sitting there and it was a Democrat president, you know, with the press have gone to such great extent as they did today to go, oh, what an absolute mania happened today in the Oval Office. This is unbelievable. It's extraordinary. And they wouldn't have done it and they never did it under Obama. Remember, Obama used to kick people out of press conferences too. But it only gets reported on President Trump. So for me, you know, the two things couldn't have timed themselves, you know, better together today. The "Time" magazine front cover and what we saw unfold in the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: David, here are some of the persons of the year runners up. We had Mueller. You can actually make a decent case for Mueller being a person of the year. You had Merkel. Let's give a nod to the Brits with Merkel.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Please don't.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You had Putin. You had Blasey Ford, Jae-in, and then you had -- it says David Trump on my sheet but I assume they mean Donald Trump. So, journalists giving awards to other journalists, I mean, there's lots of heroism out there. We have some ideas coming up later on in the show, but it's a little self-serving, don't you think? And it's part of the bubble of the media and politics, which I am probably part of, I try not to be, but I'm here so I'm probably part of the problem.

utterances.speaker: DAVID GOODFRIEND, FORMER SURROGATE, HILLARY FOR AMERICA
utterances.sentences: Well, you invite me on your show so I like you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But I like you so that's okay. We like each other.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: So, I am going to shock Raheem here and say that I don't often agree with things I read in "The Daily Caller." I don't often agree with what you write, Raheem. However, I do think Bob Mueller would have been an excellent choice. I mean, we have a memo now that names the president as an unindicted co-conspirator. When was the last time that has happened?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: They have a news (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: We have 33 indictments around the world, not just Americans. We have senior White House staff who have been convicted or --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: They don't say unindicted co-conspirator. Wait a second. Are we supposed to be the guardians of the truth here? They don't say that. Name one place that says that.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Individual one. It says individual one was working with Cohen and that is exactly --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Don't throw that word co-conspirator around, partner. You're getting a little ahead of yourself there.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Unindicted co-conspirator, but I agree with you. I agree with you. I think Bob Mueller would have been a fantastic choice because he really has changed the world. Not since Richard Nixon have we seen --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Journalists are self-serving, all right, let's go Jeffrey.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: I think that was a good choice. I back Bob Mueller as (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: The great --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes. We got to get to Jeff.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: -- it's great talking points, but put it this way. It says for better or worse, people that impacted the world.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: And Bob Mueller did do that. I agree. I agree.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: When they gave it to Trump, Jeffrey, we don't want to spend a lot of time on this -- when they gave it to Trump, it has to be this snarky comment. This is back in 2016, he shocks the world by winning the presidency. They had to give it to him. You know they hated to give it to him for, "reminding America that demagoguery feeds on despair and that truth is only as powerful as the trust in those who speak it." You know, then the picture of Obama is so like aspirational then the picture of Trump is this menacing figure in a wingback chair, like turning around. Trump looks like -- it's just right down to the photo they selected. So obvious.

utterances.speaker: JEFFREY LORD, CONTRIBUTING EDITOR, AMERICAN SPECTATOR
utterances.sentences: My favorite is that in 2008 when President Obama was elected and was selected as Person of the Year, I'm not kidding you. They compared him to Obi-wan Kenobi. Seriously. And then we get to Donald Trump, and he's the president of the divided states of America and he's a demagogue and all of this.  I mean, this is what they do. This is why "Time" magazine has been sold three times, gotten rid of by its parent company, bought by somebody else who then sold it again a few months after they got it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, a diminishing readership.

utterances.speaker: LORD
utterances.sentences: I mean, their audience is going down, right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: This is a shtick. The magazines love doing lists because lists always sell. Click, click, click, al the top 10 this. It's lazy journalism. OK. So we got to move to Pelosi because Pelosi reacted after the Oval Office, which you couldn't take your eyes off of it. It was wild today. She comes out and she makes a comment about why she was concerned about the transparency of it all here let's watch.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I will say this. You want to know if it was more productive behind the scenes. I hear some of the reporters saying, the Fox reporters saying why do you not want transparency in this discussion? We don't want to contradict the president when he was putting forth figures that had no reality to them, no basis in fact.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Raheem, no basis in fact? I mean, Donald Trump has wanted a wall for more than three years. He's arguing and fighting for the wall, I guess she is referring to when said certain sectors have less immigration. I'm not sure whether that was accurate. I've never have gotten a read on that. I'm not sure if that was accurate or not, but she's not shy about criticizing him ever in public.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: For somebody who makes her, you know, makes her living by criticizing this president, you would think she would want every camera in the room. If she is so certain that he is saying falsehoods, then put all the cameras in the world in the room and get everyone to report on it. It seems utterly bizarre - to take it back from sort of partisan politics, but from a campaigning standpoint which is what she's doing her. You would want that if you believe you were in the right. You only don't want that if you don't believe you're in the right or that you don't believe that you're oratory (ph) can cut through with the American people and I think she gets that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Again, weren't Democrats always against -- weren't Democrats -- a lot of Republicans as a populist were against the backroom deals, a smoke-filled rooms where the decisions are made, and all the people come out afterward and say this is how you dumb little people are going to live because we already made the decision. Backslapping. We had beer together. Then we're going to tell you how to live. These cameras come in and we actually see what they say when they're a little nervous. You see the body language of Schumer. I loved it from beginning to end. I love seeing the (inaudible) with Trump. Great.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: I don't know if it's the British accent or the ascot (ph). I'm agreeing with you so much. We are not making for good television, but I will tell you this. I will tell you this. No disrespect to Nancy Pelosi or Chuck Schumer, but did you notice who was missing? Did you notice who was missing? The people actually running the Congress. Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan who are actually running the Congress right now. They are running the lame duck Congress. These people have nothing to do with the final deal. You need to have all of the leaders there and that's why it was such good television, Laura, because it was cited by Donald Trump --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But wasn't that -- admit it, wasn't it brilliant for Trump to call them in? I mean, he came in and they came into his sandbox.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: And Laura, then -- but I'll tell you this. The shutdown is still going to be on --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Hold on. We are going to get to the shutdown. We're getting to the politics of the shutdown and the mechanics of what's going to happen in the next block, but Jeffrey, I think this was classic Trump, taking control of the narrative. It wasn't all clean and perfect, believe me. And I think a couple things he said I might've said them differently. But he was engaged. He was engaged and was like, look, we are doing this.

utterances.speaker: LORD
utterances.sentences: He just loves this stuff. Yes, yes, that's exactly right. And if you notice, you couldn't help but notice Nancy Pelosi's little dig. She says when reporter asked and then she backs up and says a Fox reporter. Oh, my goodness. Heaven forbid. Did somebody commit journalism in the Oval Office? You know, it's just astounding.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I think it's, again, we're getting back to the theme of my "Angle," the guardians of the truth. And when these 44 senators come out, bipartisan, they come out with the big op-ed. And Panetta was one of the. I want to play a little snippet from what he said today with Andrea Mitchell. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: LEON PANETTA, FORMER WHITE HOUSE CHIEF OF STAFF FOR PRESIDENT CLINTON
utterances.sentences: We have just seen a perfect example of how not to govern the country. To have that kind of dispute and do it openly before the press at a time when they really do need to sit down and see if there's a way to work out a deal here. But to confront each other that way and to have everybody yelling at one another, I think it's just to sent a terrible message to the American people about how our democracy functions in Washington.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Does he know his history? How democracy -- they were dueling and he was carving (ph) -- Democracy is rough and tumble. People are arguing at their dinner tables. It's OK. We are going to survive an Oval Office (inaudible). Why worry about it?

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: I understand, but listen. Don't you think that there is a difference between theatrics and results? If that debate --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yet, Trump gets results. They do personal invective.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Well, if he shuts down the government, is that a good result?

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I think, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: OK. OK. The majority of Americans through the polling just occurred in the election, seem to disagree. So we will find out again.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It didn't hurt them last time it happened.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Actually, you just lost the House and actually you say that's just fine. I agree. That's really is what conservatives think.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: 2013 shutdown, that didn't hurt the Republicans.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: No. Everyone has to agree all the time as you and I have to agree all the time.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.sentences: Correct. That is correct.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.sentences: But there is a goal in mind. That man was elected on that goal and he is going to do it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He's got to get that wall built and there's got to be a wall. It can't be a patchwork of see-through drones. All right, Jeffrey, sorry, we've got to go. We'll have a longer segment next. Sorry about that. Since Time magazine couldn't pick a satisfying person of the year, were going to do it later on in the hour. Up next, we're beyond the borders. Stay there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: This is a Fox News alert. We had another terror attack on a Christmas market in Europe. This time near the city of Strasbourg, France and officials there are confirming that three people were killed and another 12 wounded when the terrorists sprayed gunfire into the holiday crowd and then took off. French authorities confirming the suspect previously known to authorities and at this hour, he is still outstanding. We will update you on any developments as they come to us. Very disturbing news out of France tonight.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: A shutdown is not worth anything and that we should not have a Trump shutdown. You have the White House --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Did you say Trump?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: You have the White House. You have the Senate. You have the House of Representatives. You have the vote. You should pass it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: But I can't get it pass in the House if it's not going to pass in the senate. I don't want to waste time.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Well, the fact is, you can get started that way.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The House we can get passed very easily and we do, but the problem is the Senate because we need 10 democrats to vote and they won't vote.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now, Pelosi challenged the president and Republicans in the House and they might call her bluff. House Republicans said late today they will try to pass a $5 billion funding bill for the wall. This would be a stunning rebuke of Nancy Pelosi. And my question is, would a shutdown put pressure on Schumer to cough up the Democratic votes needed to avoid a filibuster? For answers we are joined by House majority whip Steve Scalise and former acting head of ICE and Fox News contributor Tom Homan. Congressman, was this part of a coordinated plan? Was this all planned out or was this the president kind of shooting from the hip on his own instincts?

utterances.speaker: REP. STEVE SCALISE , R-LA., HOUSE MAJORITY WHIP
utterances.sentences: Well, Laura, this is the president saying I'm going to call you on your bluff, you know. You want to talk about shutting down the government. You want to talk about blocking border security. I'm going to bring you to the White House and lay out exactly why we need to secure the border. And frankly, President Trump laid out a lot of real important specific details of why it's important that we secure the border. The illegal crossings that happen every single day, 10 known terrorists according to Homeland Security on average that come across our border every day. And the caravan, over 600 convicted criminals that are part of the caravan. We need to secure the border. President Trump ran on securing the border. It's time we back him up on it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Tom, look, you've been in the fight and the thick of this for so long and I frankly -- I said this on the radio this morning -- I cannot believe we are here. The country is -- this is a crisis at our southern border. Toxic environmental mess, health crisis, humanitarian. little kids' lives are being endangered down there, human trafficking, drugs, guns, all the rest, gang activity. And that's just getting started.

utterances.speaker: TOM HOMAN, FOMER ACTING ICE HEAD
utterances.sentences: I have said it over and over again. Look, I don't care if Republican or Democrat, there is no downside on securing our border. It means less illegal immigration which means you don't bankroll the criminal organization that kill our officers and there is less illegal immigration.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes. Kellyanne Conway made that point earlier and others. I mean, Obama, all these guys spoke so passionately about the need to have this fence but now Trump says it's a wall and no, no, we only got to give a pittance of the money. By the way, Jackie Speier, congressman, spoke out today. I want to share it with you. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: REP. JACKIE SPEIER, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: So he could set up that opportunity to test out his theory that he has the votes. I don't think he has the votes in the House. He's acting like he's a cornered animal and he lashes out. That's not the description of any president that I want in charge of our country.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. Back to the point I made in the last segment. Rather than offer a substantive menu of solutions here, it is personal invective. It is Trump is this, Trump is that. He's a dictator -- it's like you hear what she said. There is no solution. They're not going to argue about how we are going to do it better or we actually have a plan for reforming asylum laws that's really going to cut the flow. It is Trump is a bad person. Is she right though? Do you have the votes?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: Laura, first of all, there is strong support in the House --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Do you have the votes?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: -- for securing the border and given the president --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: What does that mean? Do you have the votes for the wall?

The media and failed politicos are guardians. They are guardians of a fallacy that the American people need protection from their own political choices. The president was duly elected and is entering the third year of his first term, but the media and political establishment are still in denial. Do you notice by the way that they basically given up on substantive debate on any of the issues that Trump is really tackling? Instead they often prefer personal invective to pragmatic solutions.

utterances.speaker: RUTH MARCUS, DEPUTY EDITORIAL PAGE EDITOR, WASHINGTON POST
utterances.utterance: The president has very little in the way of attention span. The president is undisciplined.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Secretary Tillerson, you know, called him an effing moron with not for nothing is the highest rank of moron (inaudible) that's achievable.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.utterance: He gets bored after about 15 seconds. Even people talking to him.

utterances.speaker: REP. KAREN BASS, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: He doesn't want information. He comes into the job with very little knowledge.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, if he is that uninformed, how did he beat all you smart people? That's my question. My fiends, populist movements are popping up all over the world. They are challenging the old political orders that have failed to raise the standard of living of their own people or to safeguard the culture. Folks aren't mad because they enjoy being mad. They are mad because politicians have screwed things up so badly across the board. But the guardians of the old order, they right now feel empowered by Trump's legal woes and a new Democrat majority in the House.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: -- call a halt to this. We have come in here as a first branch of government. Article I, the legislative branch. We are coming in, in good faith to negotiate with you about how we can keep the government open. The American --

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We are going to keep it open if we have border security. If we don't have border security, we are not going to keep it open.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: I'm with you. I'm with you. We are going to have border security.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y.
utterances.utterance: And it's the same border -- you are bragging about what has been done.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: By us.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: We want to do the same thing we did last year, this year. That's our proposal. If it's good then, it's good now and it won't shut down the government.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Chuck, we can build a much bigger section with more money.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: Let's debate in private, OK? Yes. Let's debate in private.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Let's keep all this private. And then the media guardians, they jumped in with their questions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Can you define what it means to have border security? Â TRUMP: We need border security. The wall is a part of border security.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: We came here in good faith and we are entering into this kind of discussion in public view.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: But it's not bad, Nancy. It's called transparency.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: We shut down the government over a dispute and you want to shut it down. You keep talking about it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. The last time Chuck you shut it down --

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: No, no, no --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: And then you opened it up very quickly.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: Twenty times.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: If we don't get what we want, one way or the other, whether it's through you, through a military, through anything you want to call, I will shut down the government. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: OK. Fair enough. We disagree.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: And I am proud -- and I'll tell you what --

utterances.speaker: SCHUMER
utterances.utterance: We disagree.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I am proud to shut down the government for border security, Chuck.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, it's pretty amazing watching this whole thing play out because by refusing to be cowed by warnings that a partial government shutdown would damage him and his party politically, well the president is actually doing what the retired senators claim to want. He is standing on principle by acting on the urgent need to preserve the sovereignty and security of our country. And by the way, notice what Pelosi said several times during that very fiery exchange.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: The point is, is that there are equities to be weighed and we are here to have a conversation --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: -- in a careful way, so I don't think we should have a debate in front of the press on this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We would do it immediately. We will get it passed very easily in the House.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: No, that's not the point.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We will get it --

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: Again, let us have our conversation and then we can meet with the press again.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Wait a second, wait a second. I thought the liberals were all about transparency and protecting the guardians of the truth. But the moment the guardians report on their conversations, Nancy wants them shooed out of the room. This exchange shows in dramatic fashion why Trump has so confounded the establishment. He pulls the veil back, allowing the American people to see just how unreasonable and how petty the Democrats have become. Because an agreement on wall funding may give Trump I guess a partial victory. They refused to budge, even if the DACA kids end up getting a path to citizenship in the process, which they would've gotten last February. And no matter how much a deal would help the country, guess what? The Democrats don't care. Score settling and preventing Trump from declaring victory on something. And that's the "Angle." Joining me now with a reaction is Raheem Kassam, Lincoln fellow at the Claremont Institute and author of the new piece, "Time's Failing Person of the Year List a Product of Cultural Decline." David Goodfriend, former aide to President Clinton is also here along with Jeffrey Lord, contributing editor to "The American Spectator" and former aide to President Reagan. Raheem, let's start with you. Your thoughts on the failure of the media and Democrats who can't seem to grasp the current moment. What happened today for instance?

utterances.speaker: RAHEEM KASSAM, LINCOLN FELLOW, CLAREMONT INSTITUTE
utterances.utterance: They love slapping themselves on the back. And the Time magazine cover is just more of them slapping themselves on the back and saying, you know, we are the people that you should all aspire to and that you should all listen to. I mean, you remember when, I think it was the Hillary Clinton e-mails came out and they said, you know, you are not supposed to read this. The public aren't supposed to read it but we will filter this for you and you just listen to what we say. And the same thing you saw happening today as well. I mean, imagine that room, imagine the Oval Office if the roles have been reversed and those were Republican sitting there and it was a Democrat president, you know, with the press have gone to such great extent as they did today to go, oh, what an absolute mania happened today in the Oval Office. This is unbelievable. It's extraordinary. And they wouldn't have done it and they never did it under Obama. Remember, Obama used to kick people out of press conferences too. But it only gets reported on President Trump. So for me, you know, the two things couldn't have timed themselves, you know, better together today. The "Time" magazine front cover and what we saw unfold in the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: David, here are some of the persons of the year runners up. We had Mueller. You can actually make a decent case for Mueller being a person of the year. You had Merkel. Let's give a nod to the Brits with Merkel.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Please don't.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: You had Putin. You had Blasey Ford, Jae-in, and then you had -- it says David Trump on my sheet but I assume they mean Donald Trump. So, journalists giving awards to other journalists, I mean, there's lots of heroism out there. We have some ideas coming up later on in the show, but it's a little self-serving, don't you think? And it's part of the bubble of the media and politics, which I am probably part of, I try not to be, but I'm here so I'm probably part of the problem.

utterances.speaker: DAVID GOODFRIEND, FORMER SURROGATE, HILLARY FOR AMERICA
utterances.utterance: Well, you invite me on your show so I like you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But I like you so that's okay. We like each other.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: So, I am going to shock Raheem here and say that I don't often agree with things I read in "The Daily Caller." I don't often agree with what you write, Raheem. However, I do think Bob Mueller would have been an excellent choice. I mean, we have a memo now that names the president as an unindicted co-conspirator. When was the last time that has happened?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They have a news (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: We have 33 indictments around the world, not just Americans. We have senior White House staff who have been convicted or --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They don't say unindicted co-conspirator. Wait a second. Are we supposed to be the guardians of the truth here? They don't say that. Name one place that says that.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Individual one. It says individual one was working with Cohen and that is exactly --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Don't throw that word co-conspirator around, partner. You're getting a little ahead of yourself there.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Unindicted co-conspirator, but I agree with you. I agree with you. I think Bob Mueller would have been a fantastic choice because he really has changed the world. Not since Richard Nixon have we seen --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Journalists are self-serving, all right, let's go Jeffrey.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: I think that was a good choice. I back Bob Mueller as (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: The great --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes. We got to get to Jeff.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: -- it's great talking points, but put it this way. It says for better or worse, people that impacted the world.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: And Bob Mueller did do that. I agree. I agree.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: When they gave it to Trump, Jeffrey, we don't want to spend a lot of time on this -- when they gave it to Trump, it has to be this snarky comment. This is back in 2016, he shocks the world by winning the presidency. They had to give it to him. You know they hated to give it to him for, "reminding America that demagoguery feeds on despair and that truth is only as powerful as the trust in those who speak it." You know, then the picture of Obama is so like aspirational then the picture of Trump is this menacing figure in a wingback chair, like turning around. Trump looks like -- it's just right down to the photo they selected. So obvious.

utterances.speaker: JEFFREY LORD, CONTRIBUTING EDITOR, AMERICAN SPECTATOR
utterances.utterance: My favorite is that in 2008 when President Obama was elected and was selected as Person of the Year, I'm not kidding you. They compared him to Obi-wan Kenobi. Seriously. And then we get to Donald Trump, and he's the president of the divided states of America and he's a demagogue and all of this. I mean, this is what they do. This is why "Time" magazine has been sold three times, gotten rid of by its parent company, bought by somebody else who then sold it again a few months after they got it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes, a diminishing readership.

utterances.speaker: LORD
utterances.utterance: I mean, their audience is going down, right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: This is a shtick. The magazines love doing lists because lists always sell. Click, click, click, al the top 10 this. It's lazy journalism. OK. So we got to move to Pelosi because Pelosi reacted after the Oval Office, which you couldn't take your eyes off of it. It was wild today. She comes out and she makes a comment about why she was concerned about the transparency of it all here let's watch.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: I will say this. You want to know if it was more productive behind the scenes. I hear some of the reporters saying, the Fox reporters saying why do you not want transparency in this discussion? We don't want to contradict the president when he was putting forth figures that had no reality to them, no basis in fact.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Raheem, no basis in fact? I mean, Donald Trump has wanted a wall for more than three years. He's arguing and fighting for the wall, I guess she is referring to when said certain sectors have less immigration. I'm not sure whether that was accurate. I've never have gotten a read on that. I'm not sure if that was accurate or not, but she's not shy about criticizing him ever in public.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: For somebody who makes her, you know, makes her living by criticizing this president, you would think she would want every camera in the room. If she is so certain that he is saying falsehoods, then put all the cameras in the world in the room and get everyone to report on it. It seems utterly bizarre - to take it back from sort of partisan politics, but from a campaigning standpoint which is what she's doing her. You would want that if you believe you were in the right. You only don't want that if you don't believe you're in the right or that you don't believe that you're oratory (ph) can cut through with the American people and I think she gets that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Again, weren't Democrats always against -- weren't Democrats -- a lot of Republicans as a populist were against the backroom deals, a smoke-filled rooms where the decisions are made, and all the people come out afterward and say this is how you dumb little people are going to live because we already made the decision. Backslapping. We had beer together. Then we're going to tell you how to live. These cameras come in and we actually see what they say when they're a little nervous. You see the body language of Schumer. I loved it from beginning to end. I love seeing the (inaudible) with Trump. Great.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: I don't know if it's the British accent or the ascot (ph). I'm agreeing with you so much. We are not making for good television, but I will tell you this. I will tell you this. No disrespect to Nancy Pelosi or Chuck Schumer, but did you notice who was missing? Did you notice who was missing? The people actually running the Congress. Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan who are actually running the Congress right now. They are running the lame duck Congress. These people have nothing to do with the final deal. You need to have all of the leaders there and that's why it was such good television, Laura, because it was cited by Donald Trump --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But wasn't that -- admit it, wasn't it brilliant for Trump to call them in? I mean, he came in and they came into his sandbox.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: And Laura, then -- but I'll tell you this. The shutdown is still going to be on --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Hold on. We are going to get to the shutdown. We're getting to the politics of the shutdown and the mechanics of what's going to happen in the next block, but Jeffrey, I think this was classic Trump, taking control of the narrative. It wasn't all clean and perfect, believe me. And I think a couple things he said I might've said them differently. But he was engaged. He was engaged and was like, look, we are doing this.

utterances.speaker: LORD
utterances.utterance: He just loves this stuff. Yes, yes, that's exactly right. And if you notice, you couldn't help but notice Nancy Pelosi's little dig. She says when reporter asked and then she backs up and says a Fox reporter. Oh, my goodness. Heaven forbid. Did somebody commit journalism in the Oval Office? You know, it's just astounding.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I think it's, again, we're getting back to the theme of my "Angle," the guardians of the truth. And when these 44 senators come out, bipartisan, they come out with the big op-ed. And Panetta was one of the. I want to play a little snippet from what he said today with Andrea Mitchell. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: LEON PANETTA, FORMER WHITE HOUSE CHIEF OF STAFF FOR PRESIDENT CLINTON
utterances.utterance: We have just seen a perfect example of how not to govern the country. To have that kind of dispute and do it openly before the press at a time when they really do need to sit down and see if there's a way to work out a deal here. But to confront each other that way and to have everybody yelling at one another, I think it's just to sent a terrible message to the American people about how our democracy functions in Washington.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Does he know his history? How democracy -- they were dueling and he was carving (ph) -- Democracy is rough and tumble. People are arguing at their dinner tables. It's OK. We are going to survive an Oval Office (inaudible). Why worry about it?

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: I understand, but listen. Don't you think that there is a difference between theatrics and results? If that debate --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yet, Trump gets results. They do personal invective.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Well, if he shuts down the government, is that a good result?

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I think, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: OK. OK. The majority of Americans through the polling just occurred in the election, seem to disagree. So we will find out again.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It didn't hurt them last time it happened.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Actually, you just lost the House and actually you say that's just fine. I agree. That's really is what conservatives think.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: 2013 shutdown, that didn't hurt the Republicans.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: No. Everyone has to agree all the time as you and I have to agree all the time.

utterances.speaker: GOODFRIEND
utterances.utterance: Correct. That is correct.

utterances.speaker: KASSAM
utterances.utterance: But there is a goal in mind. That man was elected on that goal and he is going to do it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: He's got to get that wall built and there's got to be a wall. It can't be a patchwork of see-through drones. All right, Jeffrey, sorry, we've got to go. We'll have a longer segment next. Sorry about that. Since Time magazine couldn't pick a satisfying person of the year, were going to do it later on in the hour. Up next, we're beyond the borders. Stay there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: This is a Fox News alert. We had another terror attack on a Christmas market in Europe. This time near the city of Strasbourg, France and officials there are confirming that three people were killed and another 12 wounded when the terrorists sprayed gunfire into the holiday crowd and then took off. French authorities confirming the suspect previously known to authorities and at this hour, he is still outstanding. We will update you on any developments as they come to us. Very disturbing news out of France tonight.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: A shutdown is not worth anything and that we should not have a Trump shutdown. You have the White House --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Did you say Trump?

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: You have the White House. You have the Senate. You have the House of Representatives. You have the vote. You should pass it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: But I can't get it pass in the House if it's not going to pass in the senate. I don't want to waste time.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: Well, the fact is, you can get started that way.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: The House we can get passed very easily and we do, but the problem is the Senate because we need 10 democrats to vote and they won't vote.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Now, Pelosi challenged the president and Republicans in the House and they might call her bluff. House Republicans said late today they will try to pass a $5 billion funding bill for the wall. This would be a stunning rebuke of Nancy Pelosi. And my question is, would a shutdown put pressure on Schumer to cough up the Democratic votes needed to avoid a filibuster? For answers we are joined by House majority whip Steve Scalise and former acting head of ICE and Fox News contributor Tom Homan. Congressman, was this part of a coordinated plan? Was this all planned out or was this the president kind of shooting from the hip on his own instincts?

utterances.speaker: REP. STEVE SCALISE , R-LA., HOUSE MAJORITY WHIP
utterances.utterance: Well, Laura, this is the president saying I'm going to call you on your bluff, you know. You want to talk about shutting down the government. You want to talk about blocking border security. I'm going to bring you to the White House and lay out exactly why we need to secure the border. And frankly, President Trump laid out a lot of real important specific details of why it's important that we secure the border. The illegal crossings that happen every single day, 10 known terrorists according to Homeland Security on average that come across our border every day. And the caravan, over 600 convicted criminals that are part of the caravan. We need to secure the border. President Trump ran on securing the border. It's time we back him up on it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Tom, look, you've been in the fight and the thick of this for so long and I frankly -- I said this on the radio this morning -- I cannot believe we are here. The country is -- this is a crisis at our southern border. Toxic environmental mess, health crisis, humanitarian. little kids' lives are being endangered down there, human trafficking, drugs, guns, all the rest, gang activity. And that's just getting started.

utterances.speaker: TOM HOMAN, FOMER ACTING ICE HEAD
utterances.utterance: I have said it over and over again. Look, I don't care if Republican or Democrat, there is no downside on securing our border. It means less illegal immigration which means you don't bankroll the criminal organization that kill our officers and there is less illegal immigration. Let's drive (inaudible) less illegal immigration. I don't see the downside. The only thing I think, I wish Trump would have asked Schumer on camera what you voted for in 2006 to build a barrier. What changed other than the anti-Trump agenda?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes. Kellyanne Conway made that point earlier and others. I mean, Obama, all these guys spoke so passionately about the need to have this fence but now Trump says it's a wall and no, no, we only got to give a pittance of the money. By the way, Jackie Speier, congressman, spoke out today. I want to share it with you. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: REP. JACKIE SPEIER, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: So he could set up that opportunity to test out his theory that he has the votes. I don't think he has the votes in the House. He's acting like he's a cornered animal and he lashes out. That's not the description of any president that I want in charge of our country.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: OK. Back to the point I made in the last segment. Rather than offer a substantive menu of solutions here, it is personal invective. It is Trump is this, Trump is that. He's a dictator -- it's like you hear what she said. There is no solution. They're not going to argue about how we are going to do it better or we actually have a plan for reforming asylum laws that's really going to cut the flow. It is Trump is a bad person. Is she right though? Do you have the votes?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: Laura, first of all, there is strong support in the House --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Do you have the votes?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: -- for securing the border and given the president --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: What does that mean? Do you have the votes for the wall?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: So if the president says $5 billion is what I need and ideally you try to get an agreement with the Senate and that means you have to have some Democrats as part of that agreement, but if not, we can pass in the House. We've been trying to get an agreement with the senate because ultimately to get the bill to the president's desk has been the objective, not just to pass a bill in the house, but ultimately we can pass a bill in the house. The president is saying I will at least meet with Senate Democrats and House Democrats to see if we can get an agreement. The president is trying to get an agreement to solve the problem. I think what you are seeing right now and today was on display in the White House. A Washington Democrats want open borders more than they want it for the government.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They don't want to give him a win. Isn't that a big part of this?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: That's a big part of it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: He could have solved this last January and February during the other mini shutdown when the president said give me chain migration cuts, the visa lottery. We wanted E-Verify.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: And Chuck Schumer initially agreed to all of those things, and then the radical left is the ones who went and blew the whole deal up.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: The president also said something about the wall and its current state that made me curious. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: A lot of wall has been built. We don't talk about that, but we might as well start, because it's being built right now, big sections of wall. And we will continue that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I must have missed the wall being built. What wall? Where's it being built?

utterances.speaker: TOM HOMAN, FORMER ACTING ICE DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: I think what he means is they are upgrading certain parts.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: That's not a wall. Stop saying it's a wall. There's no wall. If you want a wall, say we don't have the wall. I know it's bad because he made the promise, but they are not building the wall. So you've got to stop saying that. That undercuts -- he was great. I thought he was great in the Oval Office. You don't have to --

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: He was great, but understand, there is about 100 miles of wall being built, but that's not anywhere near where we need to go to get this job done. So there is a small start, but there's a lot more work to be done.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: That's not a lot of the wall. What is it, 1,600 miles? That's not a wall.

utterances.speaker: HOMAN
utterances.utterance: It's not the wall that Border Patrol wanted. Border Patrol has rangers that --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Is someone is telling him that, they're giving him --

utterances.speaker: HOMAN
utterances.utterance: The wall they want is the one they need and the one that should be funded. That's not what was funded in the last bill.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: But they also want the technology and the tools to keep our Border Patrol agents. And you've seen this, Laura, you've highlighted it. Â Our Border Patrol agents are under attack by a lot of the criminals in this caravan. We need the tools to keep our Border Patrol agents safe who are keeping America safe. That's part of this --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I still say if we don't reform those asylum laws, people will be pouring in on those --

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: By the way, every single member of the caravan was offered asylum by Mexico and work permits by Mexico and they turned it down.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: We've got to keep the pressure on the Democrats. They are on the wrong side of this, and the American people are with the Republicans on this.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
